FuncDef: This command can be used to override specific attributes of the specified queue s MBS parameters. The MBS value is used by a queue to determine whether it has exhausted all of its buffers while enqueuing packets. Once the queue has exceeded the amount of buffers allowed by MBS, all packets are discarded until packets have been drained from the queue.

ParaDef.Info: The size parameter is required when specifying mbs and is expressed as an integer representing the required size in either bytes or kilobytes. The default is kilobytes. The optional bytes and kilobytes keywords are mutually exclusive and are used to explicitly define whether size represents bytes or kilobytes. Values-0 to 1073741824.
When bytes is defined, the value given for size is interpreted as the queue'sMBS value given in bytes.
When kilobytes is defined, the value is interpreted as the queue's MBSvalue given in kilobytes.
Specifying the keyword default sets the MBS to its default value.
